column1: overpitched on off stump, and Babar mistimes a drive to wide mid on to get Pakistan off the mark
full outside off, and spinning away from Fakhar. Tries to drive away from his body, and splices the shot to point

chance of a run out! But he can't get the direct hit. Carey has a shy at it, but alas for Australia. Full on leg, and Fakhar missed a sweep. The ball went towards the leg side and Fakhar was looking for the single. Miscommunication in the middle means Fakhar must run back, but lucky him. They eventually take a single anyway after the overthrow
pushed off the front foot towards cover
length ball outside leg, and Carey takes a sharp collection behind the stumps
length ball on leg, and clipped away to square leg for a quick single
uses his feet! Full outside off, and Fakhar's danced down the wicket. Slashes hard at this, and manages to clear mid off. A couple more for Pakistan. What an entertaining first over
full outside off, and swinging away slightly. Babar meets this ball on the front foot, and caresses a drive through to the extra-cover boundary!
full, but closer to off stump. Pushed away with a small backlift to cover for a quick single
length ball on middle, and angling away. Carved off the back foot past point. Stanlake cleans up in the deep
through to the keeper! Just past Fakhar's outside edge there. Length ball on middle, and too close to his body for the cut. Beaten by the pace too
back of a length outside leg stump, and he misses the pull shot. Hits the bottom of his bat and rolls back to the bowler
length ball on leg stump, and Fakhar wedges a shot towards square leg off his pads. They pinch a single
how did that miss leg stump?! Full on middle, and Fakhar looks to swing across the line. Takes the bat's inside-edge, and flies through to the fine-leg boundary
overpitched on off stump, and he mistimes a drive to cover off the front foot. Better calling from the two batsmen now, a firm 'yes' to take the single
good length  just outside off, and confidently punched off the back foot to the fielder at cover
length ball on off, and worked off his pads to deep backward square. A simple flick to rotate the strike

big appeal for lbw but not given. Full on leg, and Fakhar misses another leg-side swipe. Hits his front leg, but replays suggest it pitched outside the stumps. The ball, by the way, whizzes away to point for a leg-bye
length ball on off, angling in. Pushed with the angled bat to cover point for a jogging single
pulled with disdain! Short on off, and he rides the bounce to use his wrists and place a perfectly hit pull shot behind square for four more. Another boundary to start off an NCN over
length ball angling in, and nudged off his pads to deep square leg
Coulter-Nile from round the wicket, and that's full but wide outside off. Fakhar reaches out, and mistimes a drive to cover. Tye intercepts
full on his pads, and worked off his pads to deep backward square once again for a walking single

backs away, but misses! Coulter-Nile thinks there's an edge. The bowler is convinced, Carey not so much, but Finch reviews anyway. Fakhar had backed away, and Coulter-Nile had followed him with a short ball aimed at his body. Extra bounce forced Fakhar to miss, and the ball went just above his bat. Did he get a feather touch? That's the question. And yes, it's an edge! Fakhar must go.
back of a length outside off to Hafeez. Slower ball, slightly. Fended off the back foot
good length on middle, and tapped off the back foot past the non-striker. A confident call early for a run from Babar
full but angling down leg. Hafeez looks to glance it fine past the keeper, but it hits his pads and dribbles away to short fine leg
length ball outside off, and Babar exposes two stumps and then opens the bat's face to steer a perfect shot past the fielder at backward point! Excellent wristwork
ramped! But goes to third man on the bounce. Played this length ball with the angled bat. Slightly uppishly
pulled again! Stanlake misses his length, and Babar was waiting for the short ball. Gauges the length early, and smacks this right over the square-leg umpire
through to Carey! Extra pace and bounce to end the over. Hafeez tries to cut this square, but the ball was too close to his body
length ball angling in, and nudged off his hips to deep square leg. Five more balls remain in this Powerplay
just over mid on! Length ball outside off, but it's the slower ball from Tye. Hafeez tries to drive over cover, but ends up flicking it towards the leg side with the bat turning in his hand
short! But misdirected. Lands on middle, and goes down leg
length ball on middle, and once again angling down leg. Hafeez tried to pull, but missed it. Not sure what Tye is trying: fine leg is inside the circle
full on middle, but going down leg again. Hafeez tries to flick, but it hits his pad and into Carey's glove. A smart take, on the dive
full and wide outside off, slower from Tye (113kph) and the cover drive is mistimed to the fielder inside the circle
length ball outside off, but angling in. Tapped off the back foot - with the bat's open face - to point
length ball on off, and pulled along the ground to deep midwicket. Pakistan on 46/1 after the Powerplay
good length outside off, and punched off the back foot to cover
beats short fine leg! Length ball on off, but Hafeez shuffles across exposing all three stumps, and then paddles this fine between the keeper and the infielder
length ball outside off, and the ball stays slightly low. Cut to third man
good length on off, and he tiptoes to nudge a flick to midwicket. Maxwell has an aim at the stumps with Hafeez halfway down the wicket, but he can't get the direct hit
length ball on off stump. Wicket-to-wicket line, and defended off the back foot
slower ball, full on off stump. Scrambled seam, and defended towards the non-striker to see the over out
welcomes Zampa with a maximum! Tossed up outside off, and he walks down the wicket to smack this right over the bowler's head
tossed up just outside off, and he caresses a drive to Finch at cover. No chance of a run
full on leg, and Hafeez skips down the wicket. Almost beats the batsman, but his front-foot defense takes the outside edge to point
good length on off, and pulled off the back foot to midwicket. Skiddy delivery, not timed perfectly
full outside off, and turning away. Mistimes the straight drive back to the bowler
length ball outside off, and cut with the turn to backward point. But stopped before it can go past the infield
short ball that skids through. Lands on off, and pulled along the ground to deep midwicket
short again, but turning into the batsman after landing on middle. Clobbers another pull to deep midwicket for a walking single
full on middle, and nudged off his pads to square leg for a jogging single
overpitched on middle, and he check-drives right back to Short. Quick from the left-arm wristspinner
length ball on leg stump, and spinning down leg. But the batsman opts to raise his front leg, and drag a pull behind square for one
tossed up on middle, and he skips down the ground to tap the ball away to deep midwicket. They jog across for one
chipped! But nobody's there at mid off. Full outside off, and uppishly driven to long off
full outside off, and driven with the turn to cover. Lands just short of Finch
length ball outside off, and cut in front of square on this occasion
good length outside off again. No turn this time, cut into the ground to deep point

dropped at long on! Difficult chance with the ball dipping heavily, but Coulter-Nile doesn't run forward in time. Short ball on off, and Hafeez tried to pull. But he sliced it right into the wobbly hands of the fielder in the deep
good length on middle, and pulled to deep midwicket
down the track, but just chips it down to long-off
flatter and a touch short on the stumps, he swivels and pulls it to deep square leg

run out chance some air, and pitched up on the stumps, he goes deep into his crease to work it away towards midwicket. Maxwell was very quick there, the batsmen thought it was an easy two, but had he hit direct, the batsman would have been a goner
goes aerial wide long-on runs around and slides to block it - can't really call that a chance
patted down to long-on
full ball on the pads, flicked to midwicket
Tye starts with a bad ball. Slower off-cutter, but too short and on leg stump. With fine leg up, all he had to do is guide it past the man
short of a length on off, steered to third man
slower ball, back of a length on off. He had to wait for it and paddle-pull it to deep midwicket
full ball on the stumps, driven off his toes to wide long-on.
comes down the track to this back of length delivery on off and slaps it past cover. Sweeper cleans up on the boundary.
just wide of Tye Didn't pick the slower ball, and was into his shot too early, only ended up chipping it back. Tye had his left hand outstretched in his follow-through, but it went just past
good length, pitching on middle and turning away. Guided with the spin to the left of cover
comes down the track, but can't get any timing on his drive. Just goes off the toe end to extra cover
tossed up on off, and he tries to go big again. But toe-ended again, and bounces down to long-off
close call perfect length, dips and turns, he misses the cut and the ball misses the stumps
he just can't work Zampa out. Comes down the track but can't quite get to the pitch of the ball, ends up patting it tamely back
worked away to deep midwicket off the front foot
slower ball, nearly inside edged on to the stumps. Tries to come on the front foot and slap it to midwicket, but almost misses it. The ball almost hits leg stump
better timing there, steered to third man
length ball on the stumps, flicked to midwicket
paddled for six pre-meditated by Hafeez, he had moved across and got in position, simply guided this full ball over fine leg. Got enough on it to clear the man on the fence
in the channel, back of a length. Too close to cut, but he goes for it anyway, and misses it altogether

pulled straight to deep square leg Short ball, rising up to pulling height near the shoulders and Hafeez got hold of that well. However, his placement was completely off, and he picked out D'Arcy Short with precision.
past the outside edge, sharp turn finds the ideal length and it whizzes past the edge and down to third man
full ball, driven to cover off the back foot
tossed up on leg stump, driven down to long-on's right
tossed up, comes down the track and converts to a full toss but can only stroke it to the man on the cover fence
flighed on the stumps, draws him on the front foot. Malik reaches it and drives past the bowler
he's hitting a great length. Ideal for getting the batsman just enough forward but not able to drive with authority. This is tapped into the offside
tossed up, he goes for the big booming drive, but only manages a thin outside edge that goes to short third man
flatter on leg stump, worked away to deep midwicket
lets it go, not a wide it was there for the cut, but he just let it go. Inside the white line, so poor call by the batsman

Finch holds a smart catch on the long-off boundary He knew he had to accelerate, and tried to go big, Got hold of the ball, but not quite well enough. Finch kept calm right on the ropes and held the ball over his head without disbalancing.
full on the stumps, patted back
tossed up and he drives it down to long-on
length ball, coming back in a touch on off, worked down to long-on
length ball outside off, steered to third man
clubbed Asif Ali is known for his big-hitting and he shows why. Length ball on the stumps, he goes deep inside his crease, and whacks it into the stands at midwicket
bouncer An attempted slower bouncer, it rose head high. Asif managed to hoick it down to deep square-leg
tried to work it into the legside but gets an outside edge that drops near him. They run through for a quick single
clobbered straight to the man on the point fence back of a length on off, he timed it pretty well, but it went straight to D'Arcy Short.
gets his line wrong, and with the fine leg up, a length ball on the pads is a free gift. helps it down to the fence
slower ball on the pads, he swivels it to short fine-leg, with no timing
fuller length, driven from the stumps to cover
wrong line, too far down leg and he'll be wided for that
slower ball, back of a length on the stumps. The batsman has no pace to work with, ends up hitting fairly tamely to deep midwicket
slower ball again, wide of off, he manages to get down and slash it over the in-field to the man on the point fence
back of a length on the stumps, goes hard at it but no timing.
back of a length again, but slower ball on the stumps. Has to wait for it and swivels it to deep square leg
struck on the pads, but perhaps too high. Goes for the quicker one, and the batsman is late on his flick
Pakistan are falling away a bit Malik cleared his back leg and tried to go over the in-field, but no timing again - and Mitch Marsh at mid-off holds on comfortably

Mitch Marsh juggles and holds on No batting heroics from Hasan Ali this time. Mid-off was up, and he bowled a full length delivery. Hasan cleared his leg and swung, but got only the toe-end to it. The ball was going behind Marsh. He ran back, arms outstretched, got the ball in both hands. It popped out, but he had the presence of mind to grab it again.
high bouncer, he plays it cleverly, to the vacant fine leg region for four
yorker length, moved a touch away and swings it towards midwicket
well timed, but Maxwell is there at the square-leg fence and he's been superb on the field. short ball, pulled away, but Maxwell cuts it off and throws it back like a rocket
slower ball, full on the stumps, gets an inside edge to short fine leg
gets hold of it picked up the change of pace beautifully, stayed back and clobbered it over deep midwicket
tried to repeat the previous shot, but was late on it, and the ball trickles to short third man.
full on middle, and spinning away from Short. Driven off the front foot to mid off
full on off, and skiddy. Short can't get to the pitch of the ball. Driven to mid off
slower, lands outside off and spinning away. Punched off the front foot to cover. Three dots
full outside leg stump, and Short misses the flick off his pads. Hits his leg, and dribbles away to square leg
almost a yorker on middle stump. Wedged away to mid off for a quick run. Off the mark straightaway
full outside leg stump, and worked off his boots to deep backward square. A tentative start from Australia
full outside off, and sliding away from Short. Tries to throw his hands at it, and the ball sneaks under his bat to the keeper
good length outside off, and he mistimes a drive to cover. The ball dribbles away to the fielder
good length outside off, and he backs away to cut. Splices the shot to point, and off they go for a quick run
full outside off, and he drives away from his body. Finds Babar at mid off this time
back of a length on middle, and he goes for the pull. The ball whizzes under his bat and into Sarfraz's gloves
length ball on off, and going away from the batsman once again. Short bends his knee to cut, but he's played under the ball once again
full on middle, and skidding into leg. Defended off the front foot, back to the bowler
full outside leg stump, and Finch backs away to slog towards the leg side. Hits his boot, then beats Sarfraz, and finally runs into the third-man boundary
full on leg stump, and tickled fine to short fine leg. They jog across for one
length ball on middle, and pushed off the back foot. Straight back to Imad
full outside leg stump, and Short can't work it towards the leg side. Hits his front pad, and dribbles away to the off side

is that run-out? Straight drive, ricochets into the non-striker's stumps. Did Imad get his fingertips to it? Yes for the fingertips, but Short's bat is in the air despite it being over the line! Australia 11 for 1
Faheem, steaming in. Full outside off, and Lynn comes forward to drive. The ball goes between bat and body and into the gloves of Sarfraz
full outside off, and Lynn covers his off stump to defend it back to the bowler
length ball just outside off stump. Angling away, and driven away from his body to cover
swatted! Full on off, and muscled right over long on! Into the second tier from Lynn. Classy way to get off the mark
back of a length on off, and zipping into Lynn. Defended off the back foot to the bowler
back of a length outside off. Angling in again, and fended off the back foot towards point
full just outside off, and pushed tentatively to cover. Sharp fielding from Shadab inside the circle
full outside leg stump, and he tries to play the paddle sweep. Misses the shot as it hits his body
good length on middle, and angling inwards. Defended towards the leg side, rather uncomfortably
full on leg, and angling into his pads. Fended with soft hands towards mid on
full outside leg, and going further down. Lynn takes some room in a bid to sweep, but misses
full on leg, and swept behind square. But he can't beat the fielder placed at short fine leg

full on leg stump, and Lynn tries to work it towards the leg side. But the leading edge has popped up towards the off-side, and Shadab Khan takes an acrobatic sliding catch from cover to send Lynn back!
good length outside off, and angling in. Nudged with the angled bat to cover
full on leg, and clipped off his pads to deep backward square. But a sliding effort from Shoaib in the deep saves the boundary, and then he darts a throw right towards the non-striker's stumps
length ball angling in, and Finch tries to tickle this fine. Takes a feather off his body, and runs past Sarfraz to the fine-leg boundary
length ball outside off, and steered to point. Shaheen hits the stumps at the batsman's ends, but the batsman is in
back of a length outside off. Stays on top of the ball, and fends off the back foot
full outside off, and driven with the bat's open face to cover. They aren't taking chances with Shadab. Says no to the single

ramped over the keeper with the bat's toe end! Full outside off, and he tries to paddle it over the keeper's head. Somehow manages to get some contact. Sarfraz will feel lucky that ball didn't hit his grille
length ball outside off, and skidding straight through. Under-cuts the ball
full outside off, and he holes out! Spinning away from Finch, but he looks to clear long on. Off the bat's toe end, and taken at long on. Australia at 31/3
tossed up on off, and tentatively pushed to long off. Malik cleans up
full just outside off, and nudged away to deep point with soft hands
good length outside off, and turning into the right hander. Backs away, and carves a cut to deep point for a single
good length outside leg stump, and he misses the flick off his pads. Hits his back leg and rolls away to fine leg
full on off stump, and pushed to mid off with soft hands. They take off for a quick run
full outside leg stump, and tapped away to the leg side. The bowler races to pick the ball up, and has a shy at the non-striker's end. Can't get the direct hit
overpitched outside leg stump, and the ball goes down the leg side. Sarfraz collects
length ball outside off, but cramping Maxwell up. He misses the pull, hits his body and rolls away to the leg side
full just outside off, and tapped away to cover. Slower ball, just 125kph
good length on off, and he shuffles across to nudge the ball towards square leg. They scamper across for a single
good length outside off, and carved off the back foot to extra cover. They walk across for one
full on middle, and defended towards the leg side. Leading edge takes it towards cover instead, and they take off for a dangerous single
full outside off stump, and driven with the bent knee to deep extra cover
tossed up, extra flight. Lands on leg, and nudged off his toes to wide long on. Big shout of 'no' for the second run
full outside off, but with the ball staying low. Cut to point, but can't beat the fielder
full on middle, and driven to long off. Imad finishes with 4-1-8-1
good length outside off, and spinning further away. Cut off the back foot to deep point for a run
full outside off, and driven to extra cover. Another single. Required run-rate approaching 10 now
tossed up outside off, and the googly is smothered back to the bowler
short ball, lands outside off, and turns further away. Cut off the front foot to extra cover
full outside off, and turning away from the batsman. Punched off the front foot to extra cover for a single

length ball outside off, and cut off the back foot. The ball's spinning and going further away from Hasan at deep point. He can't stop the ball from going for four, despite a full-stretched dive to the boundary
full on middle, and drilled to long on for a single. Fakhar intercepts
back of a length outside off, and he carves a cut to third man. Not off the bat's middle
good length just outside off, and he tiptoes to pull in front of square. Crunched to the deep midwicket boundary

good length just outside off. Maxwell looks to work it towards the leg side, but the ball hits his legs and rolls away to point. Shadab dives and throws towards the keeper's stumps, but he  can't get the direct hit
full outside off, and defended with the angled bat to cover
back of a length outside off, and he looks to cut. Too close to his body though. Straight into Saifi's gloves
length ball on off, steered to point
tossed up on off, guided to backward point again
tossed up on the stumps, turning. Worked away to midwicket

Big appeal for caught behind by Sarfraz and given Mitch Marsh didn't look too happy, but perhaps that was because he's out - he hasn't reviewed. Classical leg-break, pitching on middle and off and turning away, drawing his bat away from body. Thin edge through and Sarf knew it immediately
Goes for the sweep, gets a top edge that balloons over the keeper and goes very fine. Short third man is there though
comes forward to drive it without timing to cover. Only two runs from the over and a wicket
length ball on the stumps, some turn. Punched back to the bowler
flattish on the stumps again, turning away. He tries to punch through covers but gets an inside edge back to the bowler

Collapse time again? Leading edge, and it flies to the man at extra cover for an easy catch. Tried to work this ball on leg-stump through the leg-side, but closes the face too early. The ball turns enough to take a thick edge. Australia in big trouble
paddled it fine. Well played in the end, on off stump and he got the placement right
on off, turning into the batsman, worked with the spin to long-on
on middle and turning, clipped to deep square leg off the back foot
yorker from around the wicket, it looped up off the toe-end. Hung in the air for a while, but mid-on didn't dive for it. He perhaps thought it was a bump ball
he gets enough bat on it to pull it fine. Wasn't entirely in control, back of a length on off and not rising much, but he got it fine enough to run to the boundary

dropped Maxwell toe-ended a drive off a slower one that went sky-high. Imad at mid-off was moving backwards and had time to settle under the catch but it ends up popping out of his hands while he was still moving back. Didn't get in good position for the catch
length ball on leg, clipped to midwicket

direct hit and out! incredible work from Fakhar Zaman at mid-on. The ball was clipped to him, he ran to it, collected it while tumbling forward and flicked it with his left hand to the stumps direct. McDermott was way out of his crease
loses his line and goes too far down leg. Wide
steered to cover's left for a couple

another run-out chance but no direct hit he opened the face of the bat to steer it to cover, and they run through to get Maxwell on strike. But a direct hit at the non-striker's end would have seen Coulter-Nile miles out
deceived by the slower bouncer. It passes close to his body at chest high, tries to steer it down, but misses
back of a length, clubbed to long-on. Maxwell wanted two, but was rightly sent back. Even then he had to scramble to get back

big appeal for caught behind and referred there was a definite noise when the ball went past the bat. But that noise, incredibly is from the ball hitting the stumps! How did the bail stay put? It didn't just shave the stumps, but made an appreciable noise.
full ball, driven from the crease to cover
yorker at 141 clicks homing in on the toes, and goes through the batsman, but well wide of leg-stump
almighty slog-sweep, connects with air
gets hold of it this time dragged the length short, allowing Maxwell to rock back and swat it over long-on
goes again, but doesn't get it off the middle, it just goes off the end of the bat to long-on
another slog-sweep goes down on one knee and times it sweetly, over deep square leg
flatter on the stumps and quicker, in response to those two sixes. Punched to cover
goes for the big hit again, but not well timed. goes aerial with the slog-sweep but it lands in the gap between long-on and deep midwicket
full toss, but he can't time it. Goes for the big hit over cow corner but gets it high on the bat and only to long-on
gives himself room and slashes hard, sending the thick edge fine. Third man had no chance of cutting it off
dropped by Hafeez on the cover fence slower bouncer, he stepped away and slapped it high and wide. Hafeez got there, but shelled it
Maxwell's adding salt to Hasan's wounds That went like a rocket to the point fence, cut powerfully and into the gap
misfield by Imad clubbed to cover, and Pakistan just getting a bit ragged. That went through him and Hafeez cleaned up
bouncer on leg stump, he tries to get inside the line and hoick it to fine leg but misses. No wide called. Marginal that.
swing and a miss. Slower ball wide outside off, he tries to go big and misses
another slower ball, gets it to mid-off off the toe-end of the bat. He was aiming for cow corner again
through him quick ball that time, angling in off a length and he tried to go for the big heave. connected with air
what an over this is turning out to be keeps it outside off that time, just wide enough and taking the pace off. Maxwell tries to drag it across to the legside, misses again
just misses his line slightly and it's a wide. Still a victory of sorts for the youngster, because Maxwell wanted to send it over fine leg but missed
that is a bigger wide. loses his line completely and goes even more wide down leg. Maxwell tried to hit a six again and missed
Maxwell connects! Went for the yorker, didn't quite get it. Maxwell went back straight over the bowler's head, full face of the bat and the ball lands beyond the fence
back of a length on off, he tucks it away to long-on to bring up a fifty. He's been the only one who has given Australia a semblance of hope
clubbed into the offside, but only a single to the man on the point fence
length ball on the stumps, pulled without timing to long-on
fell short of the man on the point fence Shadab Khan ran in from the boundary and dived forward, but couldn't hold on. Maxwell had slashed it hard
clobbered! slower ball sat up, Coulter-Nile freed his arms and sent it soaring over midwicket
good yorker, but dug out well to cover
slower bouncer, beautifully bowled. Maxwell made room, but bailed out of the clubbed pull
that's hit the roof! tried for a yorker, and Coulter-Nile cleared his leg and sent it soaring up, up, up and away! That hit the top of the tier over long-on
length ball on off at normal pace, he gets it higher on the bat to cover

is that the match for Pakistan? Maxwell got it off the toe-end and it went miles in the air. Shoaib Malik at long-on kept calm, settled in under it and clutched it to his chest. No chance of the ball popping out. Maxwell's entertaining knock ends. And you'd think so do Australia's chances
slashed away to third man and they can only get two. So Australia need 14 off 2 balls and it's all but over
fuller ball on the stumps and Coulter-Nile makes good contact, but sends it soaring to the man on the cover fence, and Asif Ali takes a few steps to his left and holds on comfortably.

Pakistan have won the series, taking a 2-0 lead with one to play It's their tenth T20I series win in a row. The ball itself was on legstump and driven wide of long-on, but it's all academic. Maxwell is distraught in the dugout. Pakistan have won by 11 runs, and Sarfraz keeps his record intact - he's never captained Pakistan to a loss in a T20I series
